clinical_study.brief_title: China Lung Cancer Screening (CLUS) Study Version 2.0
clinical_study.official_title: Community-based Lung Cancer Screening With Low-dose CT in China (CLUS Study) Version 2.0

brief_summary.textblock: Our previous study had proven that LDCT led to a 74.1% increase in detecting early-stage lung cancer compare to usual care (NCT02898441). The present one arm study is performed to validate our previous findings and optimize the screening procedure. 6000 high-risk subjects (age 45-75) were recruited to take LDCT screening. (Baseline + 2 biennial repeated LDCT screening). Follow-up for lung cancer incidence, lung cancer mortality and overall mortality was performed. Blood samples were stored in a Biobank. Management of positive screening test was carried out by a pre-specified protocol.

primary_outcome.description: Assess the number of lung cancer incidences after each round of screening
Assess lung cancer mortality within next 5 years after first round of screening

secondary_outcome.description: Assess all-cause mortality within next 5 years after first round of screening
Assess nodule detection rate, and the types and sizes of nodules detected in LDCT screening arm

arm_group.description: LDCT was performed at baseline + 2 biennial repeated LDCT rounds

intervention.description: LDCT were performed in screening arm. The abnormal nodules were defined as noncalcified nodules (NCN) larger than 5 mm
